contentList.content:
Deals an additional [1] and creature becomes Poison until the next Long Rest.

On a successful DC 10 Constitution Saving Throw, target still takes half damage.

Targets must succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or take [1] and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poisoned</LSTag> until the next <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. On a successful save, it still takes half damage.

Affected entity takes [1] and becomes <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poisoned</LSTag>, or only half that damage if it succeeds a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Affected entity takes [1] and becomes <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poisoned</LSTag>.

Creature must succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or take [1] and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poisoned</LSTag> until the next <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. On a successful save, it still takes half damage.

Coat your active weapon with poison. Targets of this weapon take [1] and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poisoned</LSTag>, unless they succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>. On a successful save, targets take half damage and are not Poisoned.

Deals 1d12 Poison damage, halved if target succeeds a Constitution Saving Throw.

This toxin, extracted from crimson flowers, has the colour and consistency of its namesake.
Tiny silver shards give this clear, gelatinous substance an uneven sparkle.

Coat your weapon in oil. Grants a +[1] bonus to Damage and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> when applied to Piercing or Slashing weapons, and overcomes <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to non-magical damage.

The gelatinous oil coating this weapon grants it a +[1] bonus to Damage and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. The weapon has become magical, so it can damage creatures that are immune to non-magical attacks.
Grants the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FREEDOM_OF_MOVEMENT">Freedom of Movement</LSTag> when ingested. Creates a grease surface if thrown on the ground.
Engulf a target in flames that deal [1].
This potion's orange liquid flickers, and smoke fills the top of the container and wafts out whenever it is opened.
Yeenoghu's demands are simple: kill. Follow his commands, and you shall know blessings beyond your dreams.

Target must succeed a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be struck by <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADED_SKULLS_TECHNICAL_APPLIER">Yeenoghu's Curse</LSTag>. Depending on a dice roll, they will receive one of the following: <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MADNESS">Madness</LSTag>, [1], or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyzed</LSTag>.
Affected creature is stricken by a curse from the demon lord Yeenoghu.
The amulet hums with an enticing energy that draws attention - wanted or not.

The idea for the Jolt Sparker came to Yrre the Sparkstruck when they were experimenting on different materials conductivity. Before Yrre could even hoist the gold ingot into the air, a powerful jolt of lightning struck it and the poor inventor. 'My hair was poofed for at least a tenday.', Yrre recounted.
Must be wielding a slashing or piercing weapon.

Held by a master thief for the better part of a generation, this ring was put to bold use in the markets of Waterdeep. Working a crowd in broad daylight, the rogue would steal countless numbers of purses from the nobles, replacing them with bags of sand so the theft would go unnoticed. His identity was never known, but the name Sandthief was cursed loudly in its stead. It is rumored he retired, and now lives among the nobles he used to rob.
